definition[0]: the opening in a fence, wall etc that can be closed by a gate
definition[1]: a way of connecting two computer networks
definition[2]: something that gives a person, company or country the opportunity to do something successfully or make progress in some way
example[0]: The British are heading for Texas in an attempt to open a gateway to Mexicoâ€™s potentially huge markets.
example[1]: Hong Kong is a criticaleconomic gateway between the mainland and the outside world.
definition[3]: a device on a computer that makes it possible to connect it to another computer of a different type or on a different NETWORK
example[2]: Email gateways already connect various US networks to a growing global infrastructure.
definition[4]: in Britain, arrangements that allow companies to do things that would not normally be allowed. Gateways mainly relate to the RESTRICTIVE TRADES PRACTICES ACT
example[4]: The regional unemployment gateway was successfully pleaded, where it was argued that sales restrictions would increase unemployment in the area.
